messages: 2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (09:32): fell into black hole did ya?
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:33): nah doing something for 2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 real quick
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (09:33): what 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 is he saved precious comments i accidentally deleted from my disqus
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:34): friend abuse is what that is.
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (09:35): if it was not on an important post i would not have asked :(
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:36): it was not too hard; it was actually useful since i discovered how outdated our restore forum script is
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:36): fixed now, committed, everybody is happy
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:37): aside from stupid constraints in jslint
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:37): i want the fork to have only actual useful stuff
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:37): that people in real world actually use
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:38): but options for all the shit that crockford is too inflexible to support
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (09:38): Your sadly pathetic bleatings are harshing my mellow.
abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 (09:38): You could just do what the webOS dudes do, put at the top /* jslint: evil */
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:39): some things are not even options
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:39): cause crockford decided THAT EVERYBODY IN THE WORLD must write like he said
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:39): also the options should be preserved till next time you arrive
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:40): and/or a nice way to handle it at the command line
abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 (09:40): I usually tell people I had hair until i met jslint.  Coincidence that NCZ works with Crock and is also bald? I THINK NOT
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:41): till next time you arrive? hm?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:42): abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3: i dont know if you heard but.. a bunch of people are working on a fork of jslint
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:42): that'll be managed by the community instead of crock
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:42): and we'll take over the jshint domain
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (09:42): and make sure it's nice and doesnt make you cry
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:43): i think abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 works at y!
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:43): crock has the ultimate authority over him :)

abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 (09:43): doesn't surprise me.  I like the idea.  JS isn't, and has never been about 1 person's ideas (well, except for /BE).  It should be controlled by the community.  I'd expect (or hope) that Crock would agree too.

abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 (09:46): JSLint is awesome as a reference tool.  I learned soooo many good things from it and can write mostly passable code without running it through the linter.  I think some get too wrapped up in making it a requirement that everything runs though it perfectly before pushing to prod.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:49): oh wait 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, did you mean options on the website?
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:51): checkboxes ‚Äî minor. first i need to add all those fucking options to the actual jslint.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:09): k, code is not too complicated
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:09): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, do you know any articles/tweets about of bitching about jslint?
abf90f74ddda0ed35deedc25e88e00d3 (10:17): Twitter uses JSlint for their code, so any anti-JSlint tweets are automatically filtered out of your stream.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:18): no link to actually download adsafe.js
